intro: Planchonella cyclopensis, commonly known as the cyclopensis native lime, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
